title: Primary benefit of making a system fault-tolerant

content.question: Which of the following is a primary benefit of making a computing system fault-tolerant?

choices.label: If one component of the system fails, users of the system can often still access it.
If one component of the system is hacked, no information will be stolen.
If the system becomes too expensive, making it fault-tolerant will save money.
If the system cannot operate efficiently, making it fault-tolerant will speed up its operation.

content.answer: If one component of the system fails, users of the system can often still access it.
